intro: Psila boliviensis var. latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf psila, is a striking member of the Asteraceae family native to the Andean regions of Bolivia. This plant is characterized by its large, lance-shaped leaves that can reach up to 30 cm in length, giving it a dramatic appearance. The flowers are typically yellow or orange, arranged in dense, disc-like clusters, and bloom during the warmer months. It thrives in high-altitude environments with well-drained soil and full sun exposure. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
